title: Simple Ways to Remove a Roku Account from a TV

steps.title: Go to http://my.roku.com/ and sign in.
steps.content: Go to http://my.roku.com/ and sign in. You can use any web browser on your computer or phone to access this site and unlink your Roku account. You'll only be able to use this method if you are the owner of the Roku account.

steps.title: Click Unlink next to the TV.
steps.content: Click Unlink next to the TV. It's under the "My linked devices" header. [1] X Research source You'll see a confirmation notification when the TV has been unlinked from your account.

steps.title: Turn on your TV and Roku.
steps.content: Turn on your TV and Roku. If it's already on, press the Home key on your remote to navigate Home.

steps.title: Go to Settings.
steps.content: Go to Settings . Use the down arrow on the directional pad on your remote to navigate to Settings and press the right arrow to enter that menu. You'll see Settings at the bottom of the panel on the left side of your screen.

steps.title: Select System.
steps.content: Select System . Press the down arrow on the directional pad on your remote to highlight System , which is near the bottom of the menu. Press the right arrow on the directional pad to enter that menu.

steps.title: Select Advanced System Settings.
steps.content: Select Advanced System Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Select Factory Reset and Factory Reset Everything.
steps.content: Select Factory Reset and Factory Reset Everything . It's usually the first option in the menu. Read the on-screen warnings here so you understand what the consequences are.

steps.title: Enter the four-digit code.
steps.content: Enter the four-digit code. The code is displayed on the right side of the screen along with a keypad that you can use to enter the digits.

steps.title: Select Ok.
steps.content: Select Ok . Your TV might take a minute to perform the factory reset. [2] X Research source Many Roku TVs or sticks have a reset button on the back or bottom. This may be an actual button you can press or a pinhole button that requires something like a paperclip to press. To factory reset your TV without a remote, press this button for at least 10 seconds with your TV powered on. You'll see the LED or status light blink to indicate when a factory reset is complete.
